required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of Iron Sucrose in Children
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of the Safety and Efficacy of Three Iron Sucrose Maintenance Regimens in Pediatric Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD) Patients

brief_summary.textblock: Comparison of three potential iron sucrose maintenance regimens in pediatric chronic kidney disease (CKD) patients

detailed_description.textblock: Randomized, controlled, open label trial of pediatric CKD patients on stable erythropoietin (EPO) therapy. Patients will be followed for 12 weeks to assess safety (incidence of adverse events) and efficacy (clinical success)

primary_outcome.measure: Safety Profile: Number of Subjects Experiencing at Least 1 Adverse Event
primary_outcome.description: Safety Profile: Number of subjects who experienced at least 1 adverse event in each arm

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Achieving Clinical Success
secondary_outcome.time_frame: anytime during the 12 week post-baseline period
secondary_outcome.description: Summary of the Number of Subjects Achieving Clinical Success During the 12-Week Study Period - Hemoglobin between 10.5 g/dL and 14.0 g/dL, Inclusive, TSAT between 20% and 50%, Inclusive, and Stable EPO Dosing (±25% of Baseline Dose)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage (%) of Subjects Achieving Clinical Success
secondary_outcome.time_frame: anytime during the 12 week post-baseline period
secondary_outcome.description: Summary of the Percentage (%) of Subjects Achieving Clinical Success During the 12-Week Study Period - Hemoglobin between 10.5 g/dL and 14.0 g/dL, Inclusive, TSAT between 20% and 50%, Inclusive, and stable EPO Dosing (±25% of Baseline Dose)

secondary_outcome.description: Summary of the Number of Subjects with Hemoglobin between 10.5 g/dL and 14.0 g/dL, Inclusive

secondary_outcome.description: Summary of the Percentage (%) of Subjects with Hemoglobin Between 10.5 g/dL and 14.0 g/dL, Inclusive

secondary_outcome.description: Summary of the Proportion of Subjects with transferrin saturation (TSAT) between 20% and 50%, Inclusive

secondary_outcome.description: Summary of the Percentage (%) of Subjects with TSAT between 20% and 50%, Inclusive

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Subjects With Stable Erythropoietin (EPO) Dosing or a Decrease >25% in EPO Dose From Baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: anytime during the 12 week post-baseline period
secondary_outcome.description: Summary of the Proportion of Subjects with Stable erythropoietin (EPO) Dosing or a Decrease >25% in EPO dose from Baseline

secondary_outcome.time_frame: anytime during the 12 week post-baseline period
secondary_outcome.description: Summary of the Percentage (%) of Subjects with Stable EPO Dosing or a Decrease >25% in EPO Dose from Baseline

arm_group.description: 0.5 mg/kg of Venofer (iron sucrose) up to 100 mg administered intravenously
1.0 mg/kg of Venofer (iron sucrose) up to 100 mg administered intravenously
2.0 mg/kg of Venofer (iron sucrose) up to 100 mg administered intravenously

intervention.description: 0.5 mg/kg of Venofer (iron sucrose) up to 100 mg administered intravenously
1.0 mg/kg of Venofer (iron sucrose) up to 100 mg administered intravenously
2.0 mg/kg of Venofer (iron sucrose) up to 100 mg administered intravenously

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients between 2 to 21 years of age
- Patients on stable hemodialysis (HD) or peritoneal dialysis (PD) regimen for 3 months for ≥ 3 months
- Non-dialysis dependent (NDD) patients with glomerular filtration rate (GFR) <60
- Hemoglobin (Hgb) ≥ 11g/dL to ≤ 13.5g/dL
- Ferritin ≤ 800 ng/mL
- Transferrin saturation (TSAT) ≥ 20% to ≤ 50%
- Received stable erythropoietin (EPO) regimen for ≥ 8 weeks prior to the qualifying screening visit
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known hypersensitivity to iron sucrose
- Severe diseased of the liver, cardiovascular system, or hemopoietic system
- Serious infection requiring hospitalization
- Significant blood loss within the last 3 months
- Bleeding disorders
- Pregnancy / Lactation
- Actively being treated for asthma
- Hemoglobinopathy
- Receiving a myelosuppressive drug

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Hospitals and Medical Clinics; Study Period - October 24, 2005 through January 23, 2009
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Stable erythropoietin (EPO) dose (±25% of current dose) for 8 weeks prior to the qualifying screening visit.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
